result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek L Huntington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea Questionnaire and Negotiated Plea filed
Count 1 - Def Pleads Guilty
PSI Ordered and Due by: 01-23-15
Sentencing Hearing: 01-30-15 at 9:00am w/RAG

11 am Def in court w/ Atty Michael John Colgan.  Def in custody.  Emily E. Hynek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds he F & V waives his right to a PH.  Probable cause found - Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Stands Mute - NG Pleas entered.
PTC:  11/21 at 3:30 pm      STC:   12/11 at 10 am   EML
Colgan:  He also has a pending case in Jackson Co. and a probation revocation matter that's pending.  I'll be addressing Judge Gonzalez about his cash bond there.  Even is given a sig bond, he won't be going anywhere soon.  IF a sig. bond, he can go back to Jackson Co.  Hynek:  Unless the hold is lifted, I don't see the point,  There is a warrant on the Jackson Co. case.  I still think the cash bond is appropriate given the nature of the charges.
COURT will leave the cash bond.  Talk to Judge Gonzalez.  She can consider this case also.
